subtasks: Start the tractor's engine
Adjust the valves while the engine is running
Operate the hydraulic system to lift attachments
Navigate the tractor through fields
Prepare seed furrows using the planter attachments
Place soybean seeds at the correct depth
Cover the planted seeds with soil
Collect soil samples from different field areas
Mix the soil samples thoroughly
Store the prepared sample in a container
Load the fertilizer into the tractor's tank
Attach the spreader to the tractor
Calibrate the spreader for proper application rate
Drive the tractor across the field, applying fertilizer uniformly
Walk through the soybean plants to check for growth
Look for signs of pest infestation or disease
Note any areas needing closer attention
Harvest soybeans by driving the combine through the fields
Separate the grain from the stalks using the combine's threshing mechanism
Collect the harvested grain into containers
Clean the combine after use
Transfer harvested grain from the combine to the storage bin
Measure the grain quantity and quality
Record the data for future reference
Check fluid levels in the tractor and combine at the start of the day
Inspect the equipment for any signs of damage
Lubricate moving parts as needed
Empty the fuel filter if necessary
Check soil moisture levels using a soil probe or sensors
Operate the irrigation system to water the soybean field
Monitor water flow and distribution across the field
Mix the pesticide concentrate with water according to labels
Attach the sprayer boom to the tractor
Calibrate the sprayer for the correct application rate
Drive the tractor through the soybean field, applying the pesticide evenly
